meanings.definition: A unit of land area equal to 43,560 square feet.
meanings.sent1: The farmer owned an acre of land where he grew vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent advertised a house with an acre of backyard space.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the entire acre was its playground.
meanings.sent4: Her smile covered an acre of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The sun set over the vast acre, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A plot of land, typically used for farming or agriculture.
meanings.sent1: The family purchased an acre to start their own farm.
meanings.sent2: The farmer plowed the acre to prepare for planting crops.
meanings.sent3: The chickens had a party on the freshly tilled acre.
meanings.sent4: His mind was an acre of fertile ideas waiting to be harvested.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh soil filled the acre, promising a bountiful harvest.
